intro: Barleria mysorensis, commonly known as the Indian skullcap, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, hairy leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of blue or purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Barleria mysorensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional medicinal uses in some regions.
